properties.title: Prayers for Japan
properties.description: Starlisa posted a photo: Hope of Rainbows after the Storms of Destruction My heart is crying after watching the news footage tonight of the Earthquake and horrifying Tsunami in north Japan March 10, 2011.... it is hard to wrap my mind and heart around the pain and suffering of thousands of people as homes and vehicles, boats and business are torn to shreds and carried across the farmlands of NE Japan, in many cases actually burning as they float. An 8.9 magnitude earthquake is one of the 5 most powerful quakes in recorded history, and shook buildings and took out power 230 miles away in Tokyo, causing some fires there as well. More waves will follow the first, making rescues difficult or impossible until they calm down. Hawaii is under a tsunami warning... uncertain how much will hit the Islands but estimated time of arrival would be at 3 am, while on the Oregon Coast and around the mouth of the Columbia we are under a Tsunami watch, for around 7:30 am... may only be a small surge by then, but very hard to tell. My prayers and tears go out to the people of Japan and surrounding area as the destruction spreads and people work on survival and recovery.... the day this photo was taken was a day of memories... as my mom had passed away on November 7, 2003

properties.title: May All Be Well - Prayers for the Affected Areas in Japan and in the Whole World
properties.description: eemwingg posted a photo: Today, an 8.9 magnitude earthquake hit the northeastern part of Japan. Although I consider the buildings in Japan to be relatively safer than the ones back home, there was another problem that these advanced buildings weren't able to handle. The Tsunami. Hopefully, there will be no lives lost during this sad and tragic incident. Me and my friends experienced no harm, thank God. To all those who were worried and concerned, I deeply appreciate it. Let us pray for everybody's safety. ----- I took this shot from the tallest observatory in Japan. Good thing this disaster didn't happen on that day. I work very near the Landmark tower and I could literally see the building swaying... Good thing this place still looks the way it looks here after that crazy earthquake. properties.title: Marine Corps responds to tsunami warning [Image 2 of 2]
properties.description: DVIDSHUB posted a photo: Maj. Gen. Peter J. Talleri, commanding general, Marine Corps Base Camp Butler, speaks with Col. Joel R. Powers, Marine Corps Bases Japan assistant chief of staff, G-3 operations, in the Base Emergency Operations Center here in the aftermath of an 8.9 magnitude earthquake and subsequent tsunami which hit mainland Japan earlier today. Talleri, along with special staff members, is monitoring the situation as it develops and coordinating Marine Corps actions here. At this time III Marine Expeditionary Force Marines and sailors have not been directed to provide assistance in response to the earthquake and tsunami in Japan. The U.S. State Department is the lead agency for the U.S. government that is coordinating any requests for assistance by the government of Japan. III Marine Expeditionary Force Public Affairs Photo by Lance Cpl. Matheus Hernandez Date Taken:03.11.2011 Location:OKINAWA, 23, JP Related Photos: dvidshub.net/r/yfiqno

properties.title: NASA Satellite Image of Japan Captured March 11, 2011
properties.description: NASA Goddard Photo and Video posted a photo: NASA's Aqua satellite passed over Japan one hour and 41 minutes before the quake hit. At the time Aqua passed overhead, the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) instrument captured a visible of Japan covered by clouds. The image was taken at 0405 UTC on March 11 (1:05 p.m. local time Japan /11:05 p.m. EST March 10). The quake hit at 2:46 p.m. local time/Japan. Satellite: Aqua Credit: NASA/GSFC/AquaNASA Goddard Space Flight Center enables NASA’s mission through four scientific endeavors: Earth Science, Heliophysics, Solar System Exploration, and Astrophysics. Goddard plays a leading role in NASA’s accomplishments by contributing compelling scientific knowledge to advance the Agency’s mission.Follow us on TwitterJoin us on Facebook

properties.title: Pray for Japan
properties.description: Tom Cooke posted a photo: Kiyoumizu-dera, Kyoto - 21/10/10 Upon waking up this morning I heard the news of the Japan earthquake/ tsunami. Immediately, I worried for my host family since they lived relatively close to the ocean and the large river that flows through Wakayama. I emailed my host brother straight away and he replied to me within 5 minutes. Everyone was safe so my worries had disappeared. However, it's shocking at the amount of damage the earthquake and tsunami has caused, especially to the north east of Honshu. My thoughts are with everyone affected. --- Sorry I haven't uploaded or commented on here much recently: as normal, school has taken over and I haven't had any time to do anything apart from revision, IT coursework and homework. I'll try and comment and upload when I can but I'm trying to find free time! My FlickrPro account has expired, sad times.

properties.title: Radioactive steam to be allowed to escape striken Japan nuclear plant
properties.description: RinkRatz posted a photo: www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-ox5kaZHEc Japan is evacuating thousands of residents near a nuclear power plant after its cooling system failed following today's massive earthquake. After the magnitude 8.9 earthquake rocked Japan today, a "state of emergency" was declared at the Fukushima No 1 power plant. The Fukushima reactor, around 30 miles inland from the coast in north-east Japan, suffered a failure in its cooling system. The World Nuclear Association later reported the situation was under control, and water was being pumped into the cooling system. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yukio Edano, the top government spokesman, said the nuclear power plant developed a mechanical failure in the system needed to cool the reactor after it was shut down. He said the measure was a precaution as there was was no radiation leak and the facility was not in immediate danger. More than 2,800 people were ordered to evacuate after the government's declaration of a state of emergency at the plant. The nuclear safety agency says plant workers are scrambling to restore cooling water supply at the . There was no prospect for an immediate success. The plant experienced a mechanical failure in the backup power generation system to supply water needed to cool the reactor. The reactor core remains hot even after a shutdown. Chief Cabinet Secretary Yukio Edano said that the plant was not in immediate danger of radiation leak. The plant is in Onahama city, about 170 miles north-east of Tokyo. The plant is just south of the worst-hit Miyagi prefecture, where a fire broke out at another nuclear plant. The blaze was in a turbine building at one of the Onagawa power plants; smoke could be seen coming out of the building, which is separate from the plant's reactor, Tohoku Electric Power Co said. It has since been extinguished. Another plant at Onagawa is experiencing a water leak.www.mirror.co.uk/news/top-stories/2011/03/11/japan-earthq... 1イエスは、神殿から出て行った彼の方法で行っていた。弟子たちはイエスに寺の建物を見るには、彼になった。 図2は、しかし、彼は彼らに答えた、"そのダウンスローされませんが、ここに一つの石の別のないままにしないあなたは？は、ほとんど確かに私はあなたを伝えるすべてこれらの事を参照してくださいしないでください。" 3は、彼はオリーブ山に座ると、弟子たちは言った、個人的に彼に来て、"教えて、ときにこれらの事になりますか？何が、あなたの今後の符号であり、時代の終わりの？" 4イエスは、誰も道に迷ってあなたを導くように注意してください"、彼らに答えた。 と言って、私の名前で来る多くは、'私はイエスキリストを午前、'5は、多くの道に迷ってつながる。 6これで、戦争や戦争のうわさを聞くことができます。このすべてが起こらなければならないのあなたは、困っていないことを最後にされていませんを参照してください。 国は7に示すように、国に対して上昇し、王国に対する国および飢饉、疫病、地震の様々な場所にはあり得ないでしょう。 8しかし、これらすべてのものは産みの苦しみの始まりです。 図9は、その後、彼らは、抑圧することをお届けしますあなたを殺すでしょう。あなたは私の名前のために国のすべてから憎まれるだろう。 図10は、その後多くは、つまずき、1つ上の別の配信になり、お互いを憎むだろう。 11多くの偽預言者は、発生する多くの道に迷ってつながる。 不義をお掛けいたしますので、12に示すように、多くの愛が寒くなるでしょう。 13しかし、彼は最後まで耐え忍ぶ者は、同じことが保存されます。 イギリスの14このグッドニュースは、すべての国との証言に全世界に宣べ伝えられるでしょうし、終わりが来る。 （読者が理解させ）神聖な場所に立って、ダニエルによって預言者ムハンマドの話されていた15が"すると、そのためには、荒廃の醜態を、{12時11分; 11：31ダニエル午前9時27分}を参照してください 図16は、その人、ユダヤにいる人は山に逃げることができます。 17は、屋上にいる彼の家にあるものを取り出すまで下ることは彼をみましょう。 18は、フィールドにある彼の服を取得するために戻りますが、彼をみましょう。 人の子供と、当時の授乳中の母親にされているものに19しかし、災い！ あなたの飛行が、冬にはされないことも安息日20祈り、 その後の21は今まで、世界の初めからされていないなど、いや、これまでもされる、偉大な弾圧があるでしょう。 当時限り22は肉が保存されているか、短縮されていた。しかし、選ばれた者のために、これらの日が短縮されます。 23は"次にすべての人が'ここでは、見よ、キリストは、'と言われたなら、または、'が'それを信じていない。 偽預言者は、偽キリストが生じるは24については、彼らが可能でも、選択されたものかように、道に迷ってリードして、大いなるしるしと不思議が表示されます。 25"見よ、私は事前にあなたに語った。 彼は荒野にいる見よ、'もしそのため、彼らはあなたを教えて12月26日に、外出しない;'見よ、彼は内側の部屋では、'それを信じていない。 27、雷は、東から点滅としても西に見られているため、人の子の到来をされます。 28は死体がある場所については、ハゲタカは{または、ワシ}一緒に集まる場所がある。 29しかし、当時の弾圧の直後、太陽は暗くなり、月はその光を与えることが、星は、空から落ち、天の力は揺り動かされるでしょう。{イザヤ13:10を】34： 4} 人の子の30とし、記号が空で表示されます。その後、地球上のすべての部族は嘆き、そして、彼らは人の子が力と大いなる栄光と空の雲に乗って来るのが表示されます。 31彼はトランペットの素晴らしいサウンドと彼の天使たちを送り、彼らは他に空の端から端まで、四方から彼の選ばれたものを一緒に収集されます。 32は"今いちじくの木からこのたとえを学びます。支店が入札になったとき、その葉を出し入れ、あなたは夏が近づいていることを知っている。 も33には、これらすべてのものを参照してくださいまた、あなたは、ドアでも、それが近づいていることを知っているようにします。 34はほとんど確かに私は、この世代を、これらすべてのことが達成されるまでは、離れて渡すことはありません{"世代"（genea）としても翻訳することができる"レース"のための単語}を教えてください。 35天と地は離れて通過する私の言葉は滅びることはありません。 36しかし、誰も私の父は、その日、時間の天国ではないも、天使たちを知っている。 ノアの日として37は、"人の子の到来になりますであった。 38ノアは船に入ったその日まで、彼らが食べていたと飲んで、結婚して与えて結婚の洪水の前にいた当時のようには、 39洪水が来るまで、彼らは、知ってていなかったので、人の子の到来をされる、それらのすべてを奪った。 40その後、二人の男がフィールドにされます：一つは取られるものが残される。 工場で粉砕41二人の女性は、1つは取られるものが残される。 あなたがたの主が来る何時間あなたは知りませんが、その42ウォッチ。 43は、しかし、これを知っている家の主人は、泥棒が来ていた夜の見たいもので知られていたなら、彼は、見ているように分けることが彼の家を許可されていないでしょう。 44は、それゆえ、あなたが期待していないその時間では、人の子が来ると、準備ができている。 45"誰がその主人は彼らにしかるべき時に餌を与えるために、彼の家庭で設定されている忠実と賢明なしもべですか？ 46祝福は主人ので、彼が来る時に何と認める人の奴隷となる。 47は、ほとんど確かに私は彼が持っている世界中の人を設定することを教えてください。 その邪悪なしもべは彼の心の中で言う必要がある場合は48だが、'私の主人は、彼の今後遅らせている' 49は、彼の仲間のしもべたちを破って、食べて、酔っぱらいと飲み始める そのサーバントの50主人は、彼がそれを知っていない場合に時間で、彼はそれを期待していない場合日に来る 51は、作品の中で彼をカットすると偽善者と彼の部分を選任しなければならない。泣き場所とされる歯の研削があります。

This is not a shot of the tsunami wave, but I felt that this image of the Pacific Ocean would make a fitting image.© John Krzesinski, 2011.Did you know you can find me on Facebook? properties.title: Thank You
properties.description: Nachosan posted a photo: I want to thank all of you writing to me asking me about Masako and her relatives. Thankfully her family is all safe and fine but so many are not. There are plenty of ways we can help. Every little bit counts. Here are a few simple ways we can all help the victims of the Japan earthquake and tsunami: Redcross If you would like to donate to the American Red Cross for Japan Earthquake Relief, just text REDCROSS to 90999. Each text will provide $10 towards the Red Cross’s humanitarian efforts. Itunes Apple is also dedicating resources to the crisis in Japan. They have created a simple donation page in iTunes buy.itunes.apple.com/WebObjects/MZFinance.woa/wa/buyChari... that makes it simple to donate anywhere from $5 to $200 to the Red Cross with just a few clicks. Amazonwww.amazon.com/b/?&node=2673660011&ref_=cm_sw_r_t.. International Medical Corpswww.internationalmedicalcorps.org/Page.aspx?pid=1970 America Careswww.americares.org/newsroom/news/massive-earthquake-tsuna... Paypalwww.paypal-donations.com/pp-charity/web.us/campaign.jsp?c... Salvation Army Donors can text “Japan” to 80888 to donate $10 to Salvation Army efforts. They can visit mobilecause.com for terms and conditions and should respond “Yes” to a “Thank you” message they receive. Save The Children Save the Children: Emergency Relief for Japan Quakewww.savethechildren.org/japanquake Toll free: 800-728-3843 Text JAPAN or 20222 to donate. thank you once again love Masako&Nacho

properties.title: Oregon Coast - Thor's Well
properties.description: Vincent Loi posted a photo: Storm, High wind warning and Tsunami warning are the backbones of this picture's story. It's spring break, and as my last two months' stay in the United States, I travel to Oregon Coast, the infamous highway 101 for some photos with my fellow roommate. He's an amateur photographer and a student of me. After doing a week of research, we decided to go to Thor's well first. After 12 hours of drive from Pullman, WA to Yachats, OR, we FAILED the first time we went down to the Thor's Well. The tide and the waves are so high and vigorous that there is no way we can approach the hole. We are all wet yet the situation was too dangerous to proceed. Therefore, we decided to take a rest at a inn in Newport, OR and go to the Thor's Well again at the noon time of next day. We checked that's the time for lowest tide, and we are able to stand close to the hole itself finally. Still, there are waves that occasionally strikes so high that is ridiculous. Mostly due to the tsunami and high wind warning, a local resident approached us and told us "People come to Oregon may die..." We thank for his kindness and stayed for one more hour until the tide is going back up. The weather is rainy and stormy. This is the most dangerous photo that is taken in my life yet, as an unexpected wave can always happen to drag us into that 20-feet tall hole, then to the Pacific Ocean. A self-note is that this is the day after the 8.9 magnitude earthquake in Sentai, Japan, which is why the tsunami warning's in place. A deep condolences to all the people who are dead and lost their homes in this natural disaster.

properties.title: 南三陸町  Gardener just outside Minamisanriku, Motoyoshi District, Miyagi Prefecture, Japan , doomed town. FROM GOOGLE STREET VIEW 2009/2010  (from before the Tsunami)
properties.description: Badger 23 posted a photo: 南三陸町 Minamisanriku, Motoyoshi District, Miyagi Prefecture, Japan , doomed town. FROM GOOGLE STREET VIEW 2009/2010. I posted this one because I really stopped in my tracks after seeing this shot. Luckily Google streetview obscures peoples faces, but still, this is (was?) a real person working in their garden, RIGHT IN THE PATH of where the Tsunami hit. For all that, it looks a lot like our family does in our garden. The raw numbers of the quake mean little, when you see the individual stories and see the footage of the tsunami swallowing people's lives, it breaks your heart.

properties.title: Japan Quake
properties.description: IFRC posted a photo: President of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Tadateru Konoe (C) walks among rescue workers searching through rubble in a residential area of tsunami-hit Otsuchi March 14, 2011. "After my long career in the Red Cross where I have seen many disasters and catastrophes, this is the worst I have ever seen. Otsuchi reminds me of Osaka and Tokyo after the Second World War when everything was destroyed and flattened," Tadateru Konoe told Reuters during a visit to the coastal town. In the town of Otsuchi in Iwate prefecture, 12,000 out of a population of 15,000 have disappeared following Friday's massive earthquake and tsunami. REUTERS/Damir Sagolj (JAPAN - Tags: DISASTER ENVIRONMENT)

properties.title: 希望 (Hope)
properties.description: Pablo Poulain posted a photo: As some of you would know by now I love Japan, and I'm very touched by the hard time they are living. In Chile last year we have an earthquake and tsunami too and I know how it feels to see your country in ruins. So here are somethings you can do: You can Text REDCROSS to 90999 to make a $10 donation to Japan. You can follow @RedCross on twitter to know more ways to help. You pay by PayPal: www.paypal-donations.com/pp-charity/web.us/campaign.jsp?c... You can visit this web site www.jrc.or.jp/english/index.html I hope we all as people of this world could help at least hoping for hope.

properties.title: inside hokusai's great wave off kanagawa / 北斎の神奈川沖浪裏の中に
properties.description: lluìs posted a photo: the great wave off kanagawa, katsushika hokusai / 神奈川沖浪裏、葛飾北斎large · tokyo set i took this picture last january at the tokyo national museum (東京国立博物館) special new year's exibition, not from a woodblock print but from an original painting by hokusai. what i then thought it was an original perspective and depth of field has become an image of a more sombre significance, a reminder of the ancient and indomitable force of nature. glued to bbc reporting since last friday, every survivor's account of their unfathomable wait for news of their missing loved ones is deepening the heartbreak. perhaps captain scott's last written words might also become a fitting tribute to all of those who are gone for good: "had we lived, i should have had a tale to tell of the hardihood, endurance, and courage of my companions which would have stirred the heart of every englishman. these rough notes and our dead bodies must tell the tale, but surely, surely, a great rich country like ours will see that those who are dependent on us are properly provided for"

properties.title: Japan needs our help (Sendai  Rennes, France)
properties.description: lepoSs posted a photo: And then it happens again... after Three Mile Island, Tchernobyl here is the third nuclear accident with a 6 level (and more to come ?...) on the INES scale. An earthquake and a tsunami weren't enough as a disaster. I feel like being a Japanese in these days... And not only because Rennes in France, the town where I live, is twin to Sendai since 1967 And I'm sad to be so far and not being able to help except with money Some donation websites and accounts:For people from the city of RENNES in France, you can make a donation here: Le libellé du compte est "SENDAI - Soutien aux victimes du 11 mars 2011" et le numéro de compte "CCP 0823316F Rennes". Les chèques sont à envoyer à l'Association de jumelage Shimaï Toshi Sendaï, Maison internationale de Rennes (Mir), 7 quai Chateaubriand, 35000 Rennes.www.rennes.fr/no-cache/accueil/a-la-une/actualites/les-ac... 【French Red Cross】www.croix-rouge.fr/Je-donne/Don-ponctuel?elk_daf_code=T0031 -- ( picture shot on BFM TVwith the only camera I got today: my digital pinhole) -- (But don't worry French people: we have strong guys named Nicolas, François, Alain and some other who are there to prevent us from that kind of disaster. Actually they already were able to stop some irradiated clouds a few years ago)

properties.title: JAPAN - IN MEMORIAN
properties.description: jonycunha posted a photo: MEU PESAR A TODAS AS VITIMAS E SEUS PARENTES DO TERREMOTO E TSUNAMI QUE DEVASTOU ALGUMAS CIDADES JAPONESAS (MY WEIGH ALL THE VICTIMS AND THEIR RELATIVES THE EARTHQUAKE AND TSUNAMI THAT DAMAGES JAPANESE CITIES) A bandeira do Japão tem um formato retangular branco com um grande disco vermelho (representando o sol) no centro, e é oficialmente denominada Nisshōki (em japonês: 日章旗, "bandeira do sol"?) em japonês, embora seja mais comumente conhecida como Hinomaru (em japonês: 日の丸, "disco solar"?). A bandeira Nisshōki é designada como a bandeira nacional na Lei sobre a Bandeira e o Hino Nacional, que foi promulgada e se tornou eficaz em 13 de agosto de 1999. Apesar de nenhuma legislação anterior ter especificado uma bandeira nacional, o disco solar já era de facto a bandeira do Japão. Duas proclamações foram publicadas em 1870 pelo Daijō-kan, o corpo de governo do início da era Meiji, cada uma com uma providência para a criação da bandeira nacional. Uma bandeira com um disco solar foi adotada como bandeira nacional por navios mercantes sob a Proclamação Nº57 de Meiji 3 (publicada em 27 de fevereiro de 1870), e como bandeira nacional usada pela Marinha sob a Proclamação Nº651 de Meiji 3 (publicada em 27 de outubro de 1870). O uso do Hinomaru foi severamente restringido durante os primeiros anos da ocupação estadunidense após a Segunda Guerra Mundial, ainda que relaxando essas restrições mais tarde. No começo da história do Japão, o Hinomaru foi utilizado nas bandeiras dos daimyos e samurais. Durante a Restauração Meiji, tanto o disco solar como a Bandeira do Sol Nascente da Marinha Imperial do Japão se tornaram símbolos maiores no emergente Império do Japão. Pôsteres de propaganda, textos e filmes mostravam a bandeira como uma fonte de orgulho e patriotismo. Nas casas japonesas, pedia-se que os cidadãos hasteassem a bandeira durante feriados nacionais, celebrações e outras ocasiões como decretado pelo governo. Diferentes sinais de devoção ao Japão e seu imperador sob o Hinomaru se tornaram populares durante a Segunda Guerra Sino-Japonesa e outros conflitos. Esses símbolos surgiram de slogans escritos na bandeira para roupas e pratos que carregavam a bandeira. A percepção pública da bandeira nacional varia. Para alguns japoneses, a bandeira representa o Japão, e nenhuma outra bandeira poderia tomar o seu lugar. Todavia, a bandeira não é frequentemente hasteada devido à sua associação com o nacionalismo extremo. O uso da bandeira e o hino nacional Kimigayo foram um assunto contencioso para as escolas públicas do Japão logo após a Segunda Guerra Mundial. Disputas sobre o seu uso levaram a protestos, processos e pelo menos um suicídio na prefeitura de Hiroshima. Para os habitantes de Okinawa, a bandeira representa os eventos da guerra e a subsequente presença militar dos Estados Unidos. Para as nações ocupadas pelo Japão, a bandeira é um símbolo de agressão e imperialismo. O Hinomaru foi usado como uma arma contra as nações ocupadas para propósitos de intimidação e subjugação. Durante protestos contra a política externa do Japão, como em contestações de territórios, a bandeira foi queimada por chineses e coreanos em seus países. Apesar das conotações negativas, fontes ocidentais e japonesas apresentam a bandeira como um poderoso símbolo do Japão. Alguns estandartes militares do Japão são baseados no Hinomaru, incluindo a Bandeira Naval, com seus raios solares. O Hinomaru também serve de modelo para outras bandeiras no Japão para uso público e privado.

properties.title: Sailors move food and water onto helicopter for Japan relief.
properties.description: Official U.S. Navy Imagery posted a photo: PACIFIC OCEAN (March 15, 2011) Sailors move food and water onto an HH-60H Sea Hawk helicopter assigned to the Black Knights of Anti-Submarine Squadron (HS) 4 aboard the aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan (CVN 76). Ronald Reagan is off the coast of Japan providing humanitarian assistance to Japan as directed in support of Operation Tomodachi. (U.S. Navy photo by Mass Communication Specialist Seaman Apprentice Michael Feddersen/Released)

properties.title: Sailor is embraced by Japanese citizen after delivering supplies.
properties.description: Official U.S. Navy Imagery posted a photo: WAKUYA, Japan (March 15, 2011) Chief Naval Air Crewman Steven Sinclair, assigned to the Black Knights of Helicopter Anti-Submarine Squadron (HS) 4 embarked aboard the aircraft carrier USS Ronald Reagan (CVN 76), is embraced by a Japanese citizen after delivering humanitarian supplies. Ships and aircraft from the Ronald Reagan Carrier Strike Group are conducting search and rescue operations and re-supply missions as directed in support of Operation Tomodachi throughout northern Japan. (U.S. Navy photo by Mass Communication Specialist 3rd Class Kevin B. Gray/Released)

Swallow’s nest or swiftlet nest is the healthiest product that can be consumed and be used by human. This product is all-age-consuming and good for its beneficial. The edible bird's nests are become the most expensive animal products consumed by humans. The nests have been used in Chinese cooking for over 400 years, most often as bird's nest soup or other variants of herbal and medical foods. There are three different types of edible swallow nest: cave swiftlet, the feathered swallow and grass swiftlet. Swallow nest is also classified according to its colors: white, blood-red and yellow, even grey and purple. Different colors have different grade in selling but indeed having the same beneficial. Bird’s nest is the food of the rich. It contains a cell division inducing hormone and an epithelial growth factor that can stimulate the growth and division of cells, thereby enhancing tissue growth, cellular regeneration and cell-mediated immunity in humans. Mahoni.com, this time, wants to share how this product is really brilliant to consume. That is why, this application have been made in order to show All About Bird’s Nest. This application is a free downloaded for iPad user, and there will be description about the swiftlet, the nest, and the different of the types, the products and even the recipes for each product. By this application, Mahoni.com wants to take part to give healthy information to the people who concern to healthiness and the fact is, this is healthy. --------------- The Swiftlet bird or scientifically named Collocalia, or known as Walet in Indonesia, is belongs to the Apodidae family, which is not the same as the common Swallow bird. Swiftlet birds live in flocks along tropical seaside and consume wild insects. The average body length of a Swiftlet is 9 centimeters, about half the size of a Swallow. Swiftlet has a shorter and rectangular-sharped tail while Swallow has a longer and forked tail. The average life span of a Swiftlet is about 15 to 18 years. Its age influences the quality of its nest. In general, the older the bird is, the more simmer-tolerant the nest is. Swallows live in the northern part of the earth, commonly seen in China, India, Europe and North America. Swallows make their nest from tiny tree branches, dry grass, or even mud, and their nests are certainly not edible. Meanwhile, an edible-nest swiftlets, which can only be found in the tropical coastal areas, make their nests by regurgitating the saliva. The swiflets make their nest by producing it from their saliva, produced by a pair of large salivery glands under the tongue, which can be hardened when it exposed to air. . The precious swiftlet nests are therefore actually the dried saliva of swiftlets, and they are the only swallow's nests constructed entirely from saliva. It is the only edible swallow's nest beneficial to human body. Hence, swallow's nest is also referred to as bird's nest. These edible nests built by swiftlets are found in caves and cliffs in offshore islands of North Borneo, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam and the Philippines. Small colonies of swiftlets are also found in some remote areas of Hainan and Fukien of China. The nests are built during the breeding season by the male swiftlet over a period of 35 days. They take the shape of a shallow cup stuck to the cave wall. In addition to cave swallows, there are also house swallows farmed in these areas. Swallow nests that originate from different places have different textures. The edible bird's nests are become the most expensive animal products consumed by humans. properties.title: Vistdal - a Norwegian fjord landscape
properties.description: ystenes posted a photo: Vistdal is a valley that ends in a bay at Langefjorden ("Long fjord") Romsdal, approx 50 km east of Molde, Norway. This district has some of the most dramatic sceneries in Norway. This view struck me when I was passing by, and I just had to stop my car and make a photo. Behind the mountains to the left, an arm of Langefjorden, Eresfjorden, continues into the valley Eikesdalen. Here are some the most famous of all Norwegian waterfall, Mardøla or Mardalsfossene. (Østre Mardalsfossen is the highest waterfall in Northern Europe with a combined fall of 700 m, highest free fall is approx. 250 m.) This place just below my viewpoint, Tjelle, was hit by one of the worst tsunami disasters in Norway in modern time. In 1756, 15 million cubic meters of rock fell into the water, the resulting tsunamis reached 15 m above normal sea level. 32 people were killed.

properties.title: Tsunami Heights Markers, Taro, Iwate 田老　岩手
properties.description: anaguma posted a photo: Both he 1933 (lower) and 1896 (upper) markers had the writing worn off by the gravel and debris carried in the tsunami. It was hard to judge, but it looked like there was flotsam from the tsunami above the entire wall. All the concrete power poles were snapped although some clung to their spot via rebar. Before the tsunami:www.flickr.com/photos/anaguma/426953778/

properties.title: Inlet　North　of　Taro, Iwate 田老　岩手
properties.description: anaguma posted a photo: You can get an idea of the height of the tsunami from the bare rock along the sides of the inlet. This used to be a beach park in Koshida (越田) for the town, but now it is fully back to nature except for one concrete column and some foundations.

properties.title: The Gate in the north tsunami wall, Taro, Iwate 田老　岩手
properties.description: anaguma posted a photo: The north wall was either weaker than the rest or took the full force of the tsunami if it came from the SE. It was earthen-filled with a concrete shell, but as you can see, once the shell was removed the rest followed, only leaving the gate that was a passage through the wall. The southern part of the tsunami wall is in the back left.
